docs.lead_paragraph: To get a modern stained lip, Page blended two lipsticks on the back of his hand: a Bordeaux cream, like M.A.C. Media, and a fuchsia cream, like Nars Funny Face. Then he used his fingertip to blot it onto the lips.

docs.snippet: Crimp your style with a small-barrel curling iron, like this one from BaByliss Pro, which Murenu suggests using throughout the hair, leaving the ends straight. A Mason Pearson brush helps achieve the necessary center part.      Murenu kept the end...
docs.lead_paragraph: Crimp your style with a small-barrel curling iron, like this one from BaByliss Pro, which Murenu suggests using throughout the hair, leaving the ends straight. A Mason Pearson brush helps achieve the necessary center part. Murenu kept the ends looking polished by finishing with a shine spray, like Bumble and Bumble Bb. Big Shine, followed by lots of hair spray.

docs.snippet: Cecil Beaton possessed a keen eye for all things fashionable. While he found his métier as a portrait photographer, he also played the role of dandy, diarist, Oscar-winning costumer and, oddly enough, fabric designer. Now, through the London inte...
docs.lead_paragraph: Cecil Beaton possessed a keen eye for all things fashionable. While he found his métier as a portrait photographer, he also played the role of dandy, diarist, Oscar-winning costumer and, oddly enough, fabric designer. Now, through the London interior design company Beaudesert and the archives of Ascher Studio, reproductions of Beaton’s checks, florals and stripes are being sold at Liberty of London. The Cecil Beaton fabric collection — on silk, cotton, linen and wallpaper — was inspired by a scarf that Beaudesert’s managing director, Andrew Ginger, found on eBay; Beaton had originally designed it for the textile firm Ascher. In the 1940s and early ’50s, Zika Ascher commissioned artists such as Henri Matisse and Henry Moore to design fabrics, paying them £25 per motif, according to his son, Peter. All the big designers, like Balenciaga, Givenchy, Lanvin and Yves Saint Laurent, would buy their fabrics from Ascher Studio. Although not known for his brush strokes, Beaton was an obvious choice for fabric, and Zika allowed him free rein. “An artist with a color sense is not someone you mess with,” Zika has been quoted as saying. The timing couldn’t be better, as this spring’s runways were full of blossoms. Can’t you just see the Beaton bouquet on your fainting couch? [?][?][?]MELISSA FELDMAN.

docs.snippet: 8:30 P.M. (ABC) THE 80TH ANNUAL ACADEMY AWARDS An etching of a grand Roman space by the 18th-century Italian artist Piranesi was the inspiration behind the set design  --  five columns containing Oscar statuettes and Streamline Moderne elements  -...
docs.lead_paragraph: 8:30 P.M. (ABC) THE 80TH ANNUAL ACADEMY AWARDS An etching of a grand Roman space by the 18th-century Italian artist Piranesi was the inspiration behind the set design -- five columns containing Oscar statuettes and Streamline Moderne elements -- for this year's ceremony, broadcast live from the Kodak Theater in Los Angeles. The end of the writers' strike means that Jon Stewart may have witty lines, that the show will feature performances of the five nominated songs rather than a montage of clips, and that the red carpet will be more fun to watch. Jessica Alba, Katherine Heigl, John Travolta, Hilary Swank, Renée Zellweger and Denzel Washington are among the presenters. Additional Oscar programming includes ''Celebtv.com's All Star Tribute to Movies,'' at 5 p.m. on ABC; ''Whipple's World Academy Awards Show'' and ''Academy Talking Pictures,'' at 6 and 6:30 on NY1; ''An Evening at the Academy Awards: The Arrivals,'' at 6:30, and ''Oscar's Red Carpet 2008,'' at 8, both on ABC. 7 P.M. (ABC) BARBARA WALTERS OSCAR SPECIAL Ellen Page, Harrison Ford, Vanessa Williams and Miley Cyrus sit down with Ms. Walters and try not to get weepy.
